When attempting to start the standalone help on an IBM eServer p5 550 w/ SLES
9.0, I get the following message (also occurs on SLES 9/IA-64):

java.lang.Exception: Unknown exception.
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.Eclipse.run(Eclipse.java:121) 

This command was used:

java -classpath
/home/droy/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.help.base_3.0.1/helpbase.jar
org.eclipse.help.standalone.Infocenter -clean -noexec -command start
-eclipsehome /home/droy -port 8082

I tested with the minimal plugins list found at
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/misc/help_infocenter.html?rev=1.27.2.2


To reproduce, unzip any 3.0.1 or 3.1Mx build (Linux, Win32, doesn't matter, I
tried a dozen) on a SLES 9/PPC or SLES 9/IA-64, remove plugins as described in
the link above and run the command above as a non-privileged (or root) user.


java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxp641420-20040626 (JIT enabled:
jitc)) 

I can supply an ssh shell to any Eclipse committer who needs access to SLES 9 on
PPC or SLES 9 on IA-64.

Denis

You use the term "standalone" help, and yet the startup command you cite is for 
the Information Center mode (because you have "Infocenter" in the startup 
command you cite). Which one are you really intending to start up?

-eclipsehome should be the Eclipse installation directory, where Eclipse is 
installed, and it should be the parent to "plugins" directory (as stated at 
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv
/reference/misc/help_infocenter.html?rev=1.27.2.2). Given the command you say 
you are using, shouldn't -eclipsehome be /home/droy/eclipse and not 
simply /home/droy?

--Lee Anne

FYI.  I have opened and fixed bug 84943, few days ago for help reporting 
Exception("Unknown exception"), where there was known real one.

read only location.
